The main problem with reading one-star reviews of classic books is not being offended by their philistinism, but rather coming to the niggling realisation that they may have a point. 
Who could dispute the assessment of one reader of Homer’s Odyssey : “A long, tedious, monotonous, tome about the journey of a man who has slept with half of Greece, but wants to go home and have his wife forgive him.”
